##The Biggest Home Office opening in History: Children are the biggest obstacle frequent group pulling is the norm

Micro signal

Function introduction, the official account of tecent science and technology of tecent news banner, read technology here!

The impact of the outbreak has driven many companies to work online, but it has also created two working conditions. Some people's jobs, because of online work, have more space than ever before, while some people's jobs, because of online work, have nothing to do.

Source: Periscope

By Wang Pan of Puxiang

Feb. 3 was supposed to be the first day of rework after the Lunar New Year holiday, but many companies have gone online because of the COVID-19 epidemic.

As tens of thousands of businesses opened their online offices at 9 am, many called for "video morning meetings, " exposing even more women who were not ready to make up at home to their colleagues' screens. Hundreds of millions of people across the country started working from home that day. As the number of simultaneous online video conferences has exceeded the all-time high, the largest users of telecommuting software, such as Wechat and nail, have experienced a temporary "crash" and had to urgently expand the network and cloud resources, to ensure a smooth network and user experience.

China is currently staging one of the world's largest experiments with online office work. However, this is also a passive, cold start preparation of the experiment, so there are many problems to be solved. Such as how to ensure an orderly and efficient work, how to complete the KPI assessment, how to balance work and life, how to operate the post with strong attributes under the line, etc. .

We interviewed in-house employees of a number of online office companies in an attempt to present a sample of online offices in different fields and positions. Some people's jobs, because they work online, give them more space than they used to, and some people's jobs, because they work online, have nothing to do.

![img](data:image/jpeg;base64,)
How To telecommute from home

Finally Xiaomi becomes a "guide"

Early on the morning of Feb. 3, Lei Jun drove to the Xiaomi Technology Park in Haidian District, Beijing, to prepare for the opening ceremony.

However, compared with the past millet employees to his office to grab red envelopes, this year Millet Park is a lot of desolation. Only Lei Jun, ÅŒkawa, Liu De, Wang Xiang, Lu weibing and other nearly 10 executives came to the headquarters site for the meeting, International President Zhou Shouzi, group Vice President Chang Peak and other people through video phone access.

Xiaomi internal notice requirements, February 3 to 7 employees to implement telecommuting, February 10 to resume work, in addition to the necessary return to the work area of the post, please try to telecommuting. That is to say, only Xiaomi executives and employees in charge of manpower and logistics are going to start work at Xiaomi's headquarters today.

Liu worked on a Xiaomi smart product team and was responsible for external business cooperation. He bought a ticket to Beijing from his southern hometown at the end of January more than a month ago, but had to cancel his flight because of the outbreak.

Just two days after the Spring Festival, Xiaomi HRBP began to inform the company that employees who did not bring their computers home during the festival could apply internally to borrow materials for use at home. After the approval, the Group Administration Department will provide the backup notebook mail service for the students who need the notebook temporarily. However, Liu did not apply because he had a computer in his hometown.

Previously, within Xiaomi, Liu run has been widely circulated by getting the "telecommuting guide" from the APP, which Lei is said to have personally recommended to Xiaomi employees to read so that they can stay competitive while working from home.

Liu suggested in the article that telecommuting should strengthen regular communication, such as the morning meeting system and the late reporting system. Ensuring that everyone is at work at the same time in the morning is the basis for collaboration, while reporting on the results of the day's work in the evening is the only guarantee of implementation.

Be Sure to separate the work area from the rest area, and clearly distinguish between work and rest time, Liu said, so that telecommuting can be both efficient and work-related.

Liu Fan told tencent news, "periscope, " Xiaomi internal adopted a lot of Liu run's recommendations, various departments for telecommuting have put forward clear requirements. Liu's department has a video conference every morning at 10 a.m. on its corporate collaboration software, and everyone is required to report on their plans for the day. By 7 pm, everyone was asked to fill out a form to report on their progress that day.

Liu Fan sleeps until he wakes up naturally during the Spring Festival holiday. But with the advent of telecommuting, his wake up time has had to be adjusted. The other day he could sleep until 11:30 for his first meal, but since he started telecommuting on the 3rd, the whole family had changed their schedules and meal times, and his wife got up before 9 am to make breakfast, two meals a day used to need to be replaced by three.

However, when it came time for work, Liu initially did not separate his work from his life and faced interruptions, as the family, both elderly and young, sat around a fire in the living room, having difficulty concentrating on their work. As soon as he got out his computer to start work, his 7-year-old daughter said she wanted to play a quick 24 game. She finally convinced him with emotional reasoning, and his 3-year-old son insisted on seeing the "excavator" , don't say yes or roll on the floor.

Liu Fan had no choice but to run to the bedroom door closed to work. But there was a new problem. Many of the southern suburbs were heated by stoves in the winter, and their bedrooms were not air-conditioned. So he huddled in his bedroom, wrapped in a thick blanket, to communicate with his partners.

![img](data:image/jpeg;base64,)
A community of over 8,000 colleagues

Zhao Yun, a security project worker for Qi Anxin, had planned to take his wife and children to the south for a few days during the Spring Festival, but everything was disrupted by the epidemic and he had to stay at home in Beijing for the holiday.

Zhao Yun had expected to return to work on the seventh day of the first lunar month. However, he has been working online since January 28, the fourth day of the first lunar month. Others have preceded him: COVID-19's management, which has been working online since Jan. 25, when it set up an emergency pneumonia prevention and control support group.

On January 27(the third day of the first Lunar Month) , Qi Anxin internal staff received senior management notice, the company must urgently deliver to the building of Wuhan Huoshenshan Hospital, to ensure that the building of Huoshenshan hospital on schedule. The next morning, Zhao Yun began his work, Wuhan Huoshenshan Hospital in front of a number of colleagues in charge of technology through the night, he was responsible for the rear logistics and external needs docking. But he wasn't alone, because people from all parts of the company were involved in different ways.

![img](data:image/jpeg;base64,)
By February 3, the company officially began telecommuting. On the same day, Qi Xiangdong, chairman of Qi Anxin, asked his colleagues to pull a group of more than 8,000 colleagues on Lanxin APP to hold a special New Year's opening ceremony online.

Zhao Yun told tencent news'periscope that at 9:30 that morning, he dressed in a ceremonial suit, opened his laptop on the Sofa in the living room, and was ready to start working, but the children always came to make trouble, a few random keystrokes every now and then. He had to pick up the computer to run to the study, shut himself in the room, in exchange for some peace.

At 10:00 am, Qi Anxin distributed in the country's more than 8,000 employees to open the online remote office, the common point of Qi Anxin War "epidemic" map, with this special sign-in start way, vowing to fight the "epidemic" together. However, due to the current situation is still serious, Qi Xiangdong also did not like the annual meeting or New Year's Eve as the development of red envelopes for everyone.

Many of the functions that Zhao Yun does can be done directly online, such as communicating with outside agencies. On the morning of Feb. 3, he held an online meeting in his department's small group, and one of his tasks was to complete communication with a number of agencies. At 6:30 p.m. , the departments meet again to report on their progress.

At Qianxin, many employees are purely online technicians, such as programmers who type code, and their evaluations are more straightforward, such as how much code was typed that day, and how it went, at a glance.

However, there are also many jobs that are in high demand offline and are difficult to do by themselves. For example, the network security equipment sent to Wuhan Huoshenshan Hospital, it needs technical experts to complete the construction of the front, such work can not be completed only through the online.

Online offices also face bottlenecks in sales and other lines of strong demand for jobs, because Qi anxin's customers are often enterprises, before the need for a lot of pre-communication, so if the two sides are not familiar with, it's hard to go from zero to one directly online.

But the good news is that it won't be for long. Qi Anxin internal notice, only February 3-7 for online office, Beijing headquarters to February 10 to the company office.

![img](data:image/jpeg;base64,)
ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE COMPANIES: telecommuting is commonplace

Liu, a large artificial intelligence (AI) company in China, is trying to adapt to telecommuting. After returning to Beijing from her hometown on February 1, Liu is working from home according to the company's arrangement. In fact, from the New Year holiday, back home, are basically remote working state.

During the development of the company, the offices are scattered in Beijing, Shenzhen, Hong Kong and other cities, and conference calls have become a normal work habit. Some colleagues are not together, such as some colleagues in the customer side of the factory, not in the company; or sales call customers, not in the company, through the computer or mobile phone access to meetings. "It's very convenient for everyone to look at PPT together, or to look at documents together, " Ms. Liu said.

Like colleagues overseas, they are also connected to the country via remote systems. "I heard them speaking Japanese and English and shouting in Chinese. "

Given the usually heavy traffic in Beijing, company colleagues have tacitly acknowledged that they don't have to call everyone together for a meeting. "whenever you want to have a meeting, you just grab the phone and start the meeting. "

Telecommuting from home can save time on the way to work. Occasionally some worry, between colleagues feelings, face-to-face may be more direct, more convenient. But there doesn't seem to be anything special that we have to do in person.

Ms. Liu, who has an 812 year old, works from home and spends more time with her children than she did on weekends. "It's good for the kids to see me at work. How do I work? For example, I am very focused on work, to play a role model, let the child know to focus on doing a thing. The disadvantage is, because he is a child, after all, can not control himself, occasionally will come over to disturb you, cry Ah, make noise, this is also normal. In fact, you in the company, will inevitably encounter a variety of things to disturb you. In contrast, the amount of time a child spends in a room is relatively manageable."

Disadvantages of working from home, "I don't think it's good for the team because colleagues still need to meet and connect, I really don't. Sometimes, it doesn't have to be a phone call to get an idea. Sometimes when colleagues chat with each other, there is no doubt that they can bump up some inspiration, especially in creative industries such as advertising and communication,"Liu said.

However, Ms. Liu noted that the company's large data centers "are also computers that can be accessed remotely. A few IT colleagues are left to turn on the company's computers while others access them remotely. "

After the outbreak, the company was involved in some of the government's research and development projects. "The initial communication was relatively remote, and it wasn't always face-to-face and had to be on the spot, " Ms. Liu said. "I think there's a demand for online teleconferencing tools, but the long-term impact is hard to say, because we're just getting started. "

Remote communication tools, in addition to the day-to-day Wechat and telephone, the company used video conferencing system. The system has a camera and a screen that allows participants to dial a conference number directly into a conference call. If you're not in the company, install the APP ahead of time and access it from your phone or computer. If you want to access the intranet, you use a corporate VPN.

![img](data:image/jpeg;base64,)
A sudden business opportunity for telecommuting

As a supplier of telecommuting products, CEO  is accelerating production after the Lunar New Year.

"prospect" and Yuan Wenhui through Wechat communication is at 10 o'clock in the evening, before this, Yuan Wenhui all day mobile phones and computers are connected to the power, busy with the sales team across the country remote communication. Because after the outbreak of the epidemic, some governments have the remote unified management, epidemic prevention and control needs, including hospitals, many enterprises to prepare after the festival work at home, remote cooperation, the demand was immediately stimulated. "The daily business opportunity is dozens of times what it normally is, " Yuan said. "I haven't had a break since. "

This is the small fish easy to even usher in the establishment of the explosive growth. Yuan Wenhui introduced that government departments used to use traditional video conferencing, using dedicated lines and so on. But now to prevent and control the epidemic, we need to use mobile devices to connect different departments together, "That's where our internet-based, smart-hardware-based solutions come into play. For example, in a city like Suining, it took only eight hours to build an air hospital, connecting all 112 designated fever hospitals with the City Health and Health Commission and the CDC through cloud video, and then it can be managed and coordinated."

Suining's eight-hour Air Hospital, "because our solution is internet-based, we plug a 4G card into our device and turn it on. "

Through the small fish easy to connect system, Sichuan Province People's hospital expert rounds, do not need to go to the scene, directly through the cloud video remote way. Epidemic situation, in the isolation ward can also play a big role, the patient in the isolation ward inside with the outside communication all through the cloud video can be solved.

Yuan Wenhui believes that this outbreak has led people to try a new way of working. For some people, they will find this method quite efficient. After the outbreak is over, they may also use remote working mode locally. For those of you who have never tried telecommuting before, this time the value and significance of cloud video will be felt, and after the epidemic is over, most of you will be back in your regular office. But because of this experience, the technology, products, and services for telecommuting and telecommuting are more likely to be adopted in the future.

"For our company, we were already in this situation before the outbreak, with all of our employees in more than 30 cities across the country working remotely via cloud video, working from home, on the train and in hotels, which is a normal situation for us. "

From the perspective of an early promoter of telecommuting, Yuan Wenhui examines the possibility of telecommuting in the future and concludes that it is relatively conservative. "How much work space do you think the average family has in the north, in Guangzhou and Shenzhen? Do you have your own study? Can you really work there when your kids are home? It's not easy to have a desk of your own, it costs more than 100,000 yuan per square meter."

In addition to the work environment, he says, working from home can be challenging, with enough self-discipline. In fact, working from home is the norm in the United States, where more than 30 million people work from home four days a week, returning to work for coffee and meetings with colleagues.

Before the outbreak, Xiaoyuyilian met the needs of some hospitals for remote consultation, remote ward rounds and remote pathological analysis. After the outbreak, these needs erupted. Before this, the medical domain occupies the small proportion in the small fish easy company business, the main business comes from the government affairs, the finance, the education and the company office.

However, Yuan Wenhui in this area has met competitors Huawei, Huawei through equipment and cloud packaging, Small Fish Yilian tencent cloud, Unicom Woyun and other joint cooperation.

Yuan Wenhui thinks, every enterprise uses cloud video, can upgrade former department efficiency. He gives an example, like the HR level, where interviews are all cloud video, which reduces the time cost.

Even for some creative, creative mental work, we need to brainstorm together scenes, Yuan Wenhui also think can be replaced with cloud video agitation. "where is cloud video now? It's no different than face-to-face. I have good ideas to write on the Whiteboard, and we can see them all over the country at the same time. If I change the code here, my colleagues can see it. It's like you sitting next to me."
